biography:
"The Anchoress is the Welsh multi-instrumentalist, songwriter and author Catherine Anne Davies (aka Catherine AD).
The Anchoress is the stage name of Welsh musician/songwriter Catherine Anne Davies, who also records under the nom de plume Catherine A.D. A self-taught multi-instrumentalist, chanteuse, and singer/songwriter specializing in a heady blend of gothic chamber pop and dark atmospheric art rock, Davies has drawn comparisons to PJ Harvey, Nick Cave, Anna Calvi, My Brightest Diamond, and Kate Bush. She issued a series of well-received independently released EPs before switching over to the Anchoress moniker in 2014 and issuing the single "One for Sorrow.. ~ James Christopher Monger
From March to Dec 2015, Davies performed in Simple Minds' live band, contributing additional guitar and keyboards. She met Jim Kerr through The Dark Flowers collective. She has also performed live with Ed Harcourt at Glastonbury Festival, as well as Martha Wainwright.
Davies has been described by NPR's Ann Powers as "Wales's (much more explicitly feminist) answer to Lana Del Rey."
name: Catherine A.D.

Her output to date consists of the three DIY EPs she’s been drip-dropping out into the world whilst finishing university, with a full length album due in 2013. Inside of her music swirls simmerings of murderous gloom and honeyed drops of sensual darkness – the nocturnal wrench of ‘Long Day’; the cold-twinkling whirl of 'Carry Your Heart'. The EPs are bound in ribbons: blood-red, purple-black, black. This, though, is the year she goes Technicolor: Catherine has been recording stirring pop hooks, snarls of guitar, glimmers of keyboard and serrated vocal somersaults into her cauldron of midnight piano and treacly growling. She’s even taken to covering a Friendly Fires song. Don’t worry: you didn’t miss Catherine AD before she went soft. You missed her before she became complete. Read more on Last.fm. theaudiodb.biography_en:
"The Anchoress is the Welsh multi-instrumentalist, songwriter and author Catherine Anne Davies (aka Catherine AD).
The Anchoress is the stage name of Welsh musician/songwriter Catherine Anne Davies, who also records under the nom de plume Catherine A.D. A self-taught multi-instrumentalist, chanteuse, and singer/songwriter specializing in a heady blend of gothic chamber pop and dark atmospheric art rock, Davies has drawn comparisons to PJ Harvey, Nick Cave, Anna Calvi, My Brightest Diamond, and Kate Bush. She issued a series of well-received independently released EPs before switching over to the Anchoress moniker in 2014 and issuing the single "One for Sorrow.. ~ James Christopher Monger
From March to Dec 2015, Davies performed in Simple Minds' live band, contributing additional guitar and keyboards. She met Jim Kerr through The Dark Flowers collective. She has also performed live with Ed Harcourt at Glastonbury Festival, as well as Martha Wainwright.
Davies has been described by NPR's Ann Powers as "Wales's (much more explicitly feminist) answer to Lana Del Rey."
theaudiodb.name: The Anchoress

lastfm.bio_content: Catherine A.D. is the musical moniker of Welsh multi-instrumentalist and songwriter Catherine Anne Davies. Her output to date consists of the three DIY EPs she’s been drip-dropping out into the world whilst finishing university, with a full length album due in 2013. Inside of her music swirls simmerings of murderous gloom and honeyed drops of sensual darkness – the nocturnal wrench of ‘Long Day’; the cold-twinkling whirl of 'Carry Your Heart'. The EPs are bound in ribbons: blood-red, purple-black, black. This, though, is the year she goes Technicolor: Catherine has been recording stirring pop hooks, snarls of guitar, glimmers of keyboard and serrated vocal somersaults into her cauldron of midnight piano and treacly growling. She’s even taken to covering a Friendly Fires song. Don’t worry: you didn’t miss Catherine AD before she went soft. You missed her before she became complete. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
lastfm.bio_summary: Catherine A.D. is the musical moniker of Welsh multi-instrumentalist and songwriter Catherine Anne Davies. Her output to date consists of the three DIY EPs she’s been drip-dropping out into the world whilst finishing university, with a full length album due in 2013. Inside of her music swirls simmerings of murderous gloom and honeyed drops of sensual darkness – the nocturnal wrench of ‘Long Day’; the cold-twinkling whirl of 'Carry Your Heart'. Read more on Last.fm
lastfm.name: Catherine A.D.

From March to Dec 2015, Davies performed in Simple Minds' live band, contributing additional guitar and keyboards. She met Jim Kerr through The Dark Flowers collective. She has also performed live with Ed Harcourt at Glastonbury Festival, as well as Martha Wainwright.
Davies has been described by NPR's Ann Powers as "Wales's (much more explicitly feminist) answer to Lana Del Rey."
